The Tivoli took a cargo from New York to Chagres. After discharging there, she sailed for Berwick's Buy, orr the coast of Louis-
to New Orleans. She arrived here in the midst of the epidemic
yellow fever. A new crew was obtained, and she again put out for
crew consisted of unacclimated men, and the vessel had hardly
board, and prevailed to such an extent, that she had to be left to
the mercy of the waves. She was cast on Last Island, from which
she was taken by Judge Baker's hands. What occurred afterwards
